glossary: with possibility of separation or individuation; "the two ideas were considered separably"
capable of being divided or dissociated; "often drugs and crime are not dissociable"; "the siamese twins were not considered seperable"; "a song...never conceived of as severable from the melody";
capable of being repaired or rectified; "reparable damage to the car"; "rectifiable wrongs"
subject to repayment; "business loans are usually repayable in regular installments"
